org.hyperic.hq.hqapi1
Class ResourceApi

java.lang.Object
  org.hyperic.hq.hqapi1.ResourceApi

public class ResourceApi
extends java.lang.Object

The Hyperic HQ Resource API.

This class provides access to the Resources and ResourcePrototypes within the HQ system. Each of the methods in this class return Response objects that wrap the result of the method with a ResponseStatus and a ServiceError that indicates the error if the response status is ResponseStatus.FAILURE.

A ResourcePrototype is a class of Resource. For example, Linux, OS X, FileServer File, Nagios Check

A Resource is an instance of a ResourcePrototype. For example, google.com port 80 check, Local Tomcat Instance

Method Detail

getAllResourcePrototypes

public ResourcePrototypesResponse getAllResourcePrototypes()
                                                    throws java.io.IOException
Find all ResourcePrototypes in the system.

Returns:
On ResponseStatus.SUCCESS, the list of ResourcePrototypes are returned via ResourcePrototypesResponse.getResourcePrototype().
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a network error occurs while making the request.

getResourcePrototypes

public ResourcePrototypesResponse getResourcePrototypes()
                                                 throws java.io.IOException
Find ResourcePrototypes in the system that have at least 1 Resource of that type.

Returns:
On ResponseStatus.SUCCESS, the list of ResourcePrototypes are returned via ResourcePrototypesResponse.getResourcePrototype().
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a network error occurs while making the request.

createPlatform

public ResourceResponse createPlatform(Agent agent,
                                       ResourcePrototype type,
                                       java.lang.String name,
                                       java.lang.String fqdn,
                                       java.util.List<Ip> ips,
                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> config)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Create a Platform Resource with the given name.

Parameters:
agent - The Agent which will service this platform.
type - The resource prototype for the resource to be created.
name - The name of the resource to create.
fqdn - The FQDN for the platform.
ips - The list of Ips for this platform.
config - The configuration for the platform.
Returns:
On ResponseStatus.SUCCESS, the created Resource is returned via ResourceResponse.getResource().
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a network error occurs while making the request.

                              throws java.io.IOException
Create a Server Resource with the given name.

Parameters:
type - The resource prototype for the resource to be created.
parent - The parent resource for the created resource.
name - The name of the resource to create.
config - The configuration for the server.
Returns:
On ResponseStatus.SUCCESS, the created Resource is returned via ResourceResponse.getResource().

java.io.IOException - If a network error occurs while making the request.

createService

public ResourceResponse createService(ResourcePrototype type,
                                      Resource parent,
                                      java.lang.String name,
                                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> config)
                               throws java.io.IOException
Create a Service Resource with the given name.

Parameters:
type - The ResourcePrototype for the resource to be created.
parent - The parent Resource for the created resource. In the case of platform service checks like HTTP, the parent resource will be the platform Resource.
name - The name of the resource to create.
config - The configuration for the service.
Returns:
On ResponseStatus.SUCCESS, the created Resource is returned via ResourceResponse.getResource().
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a network error occurs while making the request.

getResource

public ResourceResponse getResource(int id,
                                    boolean verbose,
                                    boolean children)
                             throws java.io.IOException
Get a Resource by id.

Parameters:
id - The resource id to look up.
verbose - Flag to indicate whether ResourceConfig and ResourceProperty information will be included.
children - Flag to control whether child resources of this resource will be included.
Returns:
On ResponseStatus.SUCCESS, the Resource is returned via ResourceResponse.getResource().
Throws:
java.io.IOException - If a network error occurs while making the request.
